section.title: Deliberate Practice: Movement on the Number Line
section.p: Algebra is a skill, which means it requires practice to become proficient. But it will take more than rote repetition to get there. Deliberate practice is the thoughtful repetition of a task. For each of these sections, you will be given a list of specific skills or ideas to focus on as you practice thinking through the problems.

li.p: Indicate the direction that you are facing at each step.
Indicate the motion at each step using arrows.

worksheet.p: Instructions: Draw a movement diagram to represent the calculation and compute the result.

exercise.p: Draw a movement diagram for 3 + 2 and compute the result.
Draw a movement diagram for 2 - 5 and compute the result.
Draw a movement diagram for 6 - 4 and compute the result.
Draw a movement diagram for -3 + 5 and compute the result.
Draw a movement diagram for -5 - (-3) and compute the result.
Draw a movement diagram for -4 + (-2) and compute the result.
Draw a movement diagram for 3 + (-4) and compute the result.
Draw a movement diagram for 4 - 9 and compute the result.
Draw a movement diagram for -3 + 7 and compute the result.
Draw a movement diagram for -4 - (-3) and compute the result.
